# Question

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

```julia
function add_yearmonth(df)
    df[:, :ym] = Dates.format.(df[:, :dt]], "Ym")
end
```

This function, `add_yearmonth`, takes a DataFrame `df` as input. It creates a new column named `ym` and assigns the calculated values to it.

The `Dates.format` function is used to convert the DateTime values in the `dt` column into a string format "yyyymm". The `.(...)` syntax applies the formatting to each row of the DataFrame.
